free_text.Learning outcomes: [br/]The study of polymer morphology and microdeformation using various types of microscopy and diffraction techniques down to the molecular level.[br/]Acquisition of the basic knowledge necessary for the practical application of these methods to polymers.[br/]Understanding of the origins and importance of the phenomena encountered.[br/]
free_text.Content: I. INTRODUCTION[br/][li]overview of polymers[br/][li]importance of polymer morphology in practice[br/] [br/] II. METHODS[br/][li]sample preparation[br/][li]application of the different types of microscopy to polymers (OM, TEM, SEM, scanning probe microscopy ...)[br/][li]crystallographic methods, numerical simulation[br/] [br/] III. APPLICATIONS[br/][li]semicrystalline polymers and liquid crystalline polymers[br/][li]supermolecular structures[br/][li]fractography and microdeformation[br/][li]nanostructures and self-organization[br/]
free_text.Form of examination: Written exam after 4-5 weeks + oral presentation in group of 2 people at the end of the course.[br/]Final grade = (2x presentation grade + 1x written exam grade) /3
